content.title: National Post Doctoral Fellowship
content.details: The National Post Doctoral Fellowship (NPDF) is designed to support researchers who have completed their Ph.D. and wish to pursue post-doctoral research in recognized academic institutions, national laboratories, and other recognized R&D institutions in India.
eligibility: Ph.D. degree in Science or Engineering or M.D/M.S degree in any area of medicine
Candidates who have submitted their Ph.D./M.D./M.S thesis and are awaiting the award of the degree are also eligible
Outstanding track record in research outputs and publications
Upper age limit of 35 years at the time of application submission, with age relaxation for SC/ST/OBC/Physically Challenged & Women candidates
exclusions: Fellowship cannot be availed at the same institution where the Ph.D. was obtained
Fellowship cannot be availed with the doctoral thesis supervisor or co-supervisor as a mentor
Fellows are not eligible to receive fellowship/salary from any other Government or Non-Governmental source during the tenure
content.application_process: Applications must be submitted through the SERB online portal www.serbonline.in, usually within a one-month window after the call for applications is announced.
documents_required: Proof of Date of Birth (Class X certificate or Date of Birth Certificate)
Proof of Caste (only for cases seeking age relaxation)
Proof of Ph.D. Degree or proof of Ph.D. thesis submission certificate
Endorsement Certificate signed by Mentor and Head of the Host Institution

faqs.question: What is the age limit for availing NPDF?
faqs.answer: The upper age limit for the fellowship is 35 years at the time of the submission of application, with age relaxation of 5 years for SC/ST/OBC/Physically Challenged & Women candidates.

faqs.question: What is the tenure of the NPDF? Can it be extended?
faqs.answer: The fellowship is tenable initially for a period of 2 years and can be extended for one more year in exceptional cases, but not beyond three years.

faqs.question: Can I recruit manpower under this scheme?
faqs.answer: There is no provision for providing manpower under this scheme. The Fellow is expected to undertake research himself/herself during the entire duration of the fellowship.

faqs.question: What are the rules for availing leave?
faqs.answer: The NPDF is entitled to leave as per the norms of the host institution. Participation in scientific workshops held in India or abroad will be treated as on duty.
